sen.j: 松平 重忠（まつだいら しげただ、1570年（元亀元年）- 1626年8月22日（寛永3年7月1日 (旧暦)）は、安土桃山時代、江戸時代の武将、大名。
sen.e: Shigetada MATSUDAIRA (1570 - August 22, 1626) was a busho (Japanese military commander) and daimyo (Japanese territorial lord) over the Azuchi-momoyama period to the Edo period.
Shigetada MATSUDAIRA (1570 - August 22, 1626) was a busho (Japanese military commander) and daimyo (Japanese territorial lord) from the Azuchi-Momoyama period to the Edo period.
Shigetada MATSUDAIRA (1570 - August 22, 1626) was a busho (Japanese military commander) and daimyo (Japanese territorial lord) from the Azuchi-Momoyama period to the Edo period.

sen.j: 遠江国横須賀藩2代藩主、出羽国上山藩初代藩主。
sen.e: He was the second lord of the Yokosuka Domain, Totomi Province and the first lord of the Kaminoyama Domain, Dewa Province.
He was the second lord of the Yokosuka Domain, Totomi Province and the first lord of the Kaminoyama Domain, Dewa Province.
He was the second lord of the Yokosuka Domain, Totomi Province and the first lord of the Kaminoyama Domain, Dewa Province.
He was the second generation of the Nomi Matsudaira family in Kitsuki Domain.
He was the second generation of the Nomi Matsudaira family in Kitsuki Domain.
He was the second generation of the Nomi Matsudaira family in Kitsuki Domain.

sen.j: 横須賀藩初代藩主・松平重勝の長男。
sen.e: He was the first son of Shigekatsu MATSUDAIRA, the first lord of the Yokosuka Domain.
The oldest son of Shigekatsu MATSUDAIRA, the first lord of the Yokosuka Domain.
The oldest son of Shigekatsu MATSUDAIRA, the first lord of the Yokosuka Domain.
His mother was the daughter of Tadayoshi TORII.
His mother was the daughter of Tadayoshi TORII.
His mother was the daughter of Tadayoshi TORII.

sen.j: 弟に松平重長、松平勝隆など。
sen.e: His younger brothers included Shigenaga MATSUDAIRA and Katsutaka MATSUDAIRA.
His younger brothers included Shigenaga MATSUDAIRA and Katsutaka MATSUDAIRA.
His younger brothers included Shigenaga MATSUDAIRA and Katsutaka MATSUDAIRA.
His lawful wife was the daughter of Tadatsugu TODA.
His lawful wife was the daughter of Tadatsugu TODA.
His lawful wife was the daughter of Tadatsugu TODA.

sen.j: 子は娘（屋代忠正継室）、娘（松平重直正室）。
sen.e: Her daughters were the second wife of Tadamasa YASHIRO and the lawful wife of Shigenao MATSUDAIRA.
The second wife of Tadamasa YASHIRO and the lawful wife of Shigenao MATSUDAIRA were his daughters.
The second wife of Tadamasa YASHIRO and the lawful wife of Shigenao MATSUDAIRA were his daughters.
His adopted child was Shigenao MATSUDAIRA.
Shigenao MATSUDAIRA was his adopted son.
Shigenao MATSUDAIRA was his adopted son.
His official rank was Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade).
His official rank was Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade).
His official rank was Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade).
He was Tango no kuni no kami (governor of Tango Province).
He was Tango no kuni no kami (Governor of Tango Province).
He was Tango no kuni no kami (Governor of Tango Province).

sen.j: 慶長17年（1612年）に大番頭となる。
sen.e: In 1612, he became Oban gashira (captains of the great guards).
In 1612, he became Oban gashira (captains of the great guards).
In 1612, he became Oban gashira (captains of the great guards).

sen.j: 慶長19年（1614年）に大坂の役が始まると、冬の陣では大坂城攻め、夏の陣では伏見城守備を担当した。
sen.e: When Osaka no Eki (The Siege of Osaka) began in 1614, he was involved in the attack on Osaka-jo Castle in winter and worked to secure Fushimi-jo Castle in summer.
When Osaka no Eki (The Siege of Osaka) began in 1614, he was involved in the attack on Osaka-jo Castle in winter and worked to secure Fushimi-jo Castle in summer.
When Osaka no Eki (The Siege of Osaka) began in 1614, he was involved in the attack on Osaka-jo Castle in winter and worked to secure Fushimi-jo Castle in summer.

sen.j: 元和 (日本)7年（1621年）、駿府城代に任じられた。
sen.e: In 1621, he was appointed to the keeper of Sunpu-jo Castle.
In 1621, he was appointed to the keeper of Sunpu-jo Castle.
In 1621, he was appointed to the keeper of Sunpu-jo Castle.

sen.j: 同年に家督を継ぎ横須賀藩主となる。
sen.e: In the same year, he took over as the head of the family and became the lord of the Yokosuka Domain.
In the same year, he took over as the head of the family and became the lord of the Yokosuka Domain.
In the same year, he took over as the head of the family and became the lord of the Yokosuka Domain.

sen.j: 元和8年（1622年）には出羽国上山藩4万石に加増移封された。
sen.e: In 1622, he was transferred to the Kaminoyama Domain, Dewa Province with his revenues increased to 40,000 koku.
In 1622, he was transferred to the Kaminoyama Domain, Dewa Province with his revenues increased to 40,000 koku.
In 1622, he was transferred to the Kaminoyama Domain, Dewa Province with his revenues increased to 40,000 koku.

sen.j: 寛永3年（1626年）7月1日、57歳で死去。
sen.e: On July 1, 1626, he died at age 57.
On August 22, 1626, he died at the age of 57.
sen.cmt: グレゴリオ暦に直しました。
sen.e: On August 22, 1626, he died at the age of 57.

sen.j: 墓地は東京都文京区小石川の伝通院。
sen.e: His grave is in Dentsu-in Temple in Koishikawa, Bunkyo Ward, Tokyo.
His grave is located in Dentsu-in Temple in Koishikawa, Bunkyo Ward, Tokyo Prefecture.
His grave is located in Dentsu-in Temple in Koishikawa, Bunkyo Ward, Tokyo Prefecture.

sen.j: 養子の重直は、1万石の減封をもって摂津国三田藩3万石に移封となった。
sen.e: His adopted child, Shigenao earned a punishment with deprivation of 10,000 koku and was transferred to the Sanda Domain, Settsu Province with reduced revenues of 30,000 koku.
His adopted child, Shigenao earned a punishment with deprivation of 10,000 koku and was transferred to the Sanda Domain, Settsu Province with reduced revenues of 30,000 koku.
